comments.body: I can't easily check right now, but do we have a convention for naming special dirs?  I kind of expected to see "Kubernetes" in the path.  @pmorie - is there a convention established that says this is where kube looks for special things or is it just /etc/something   ?

I think a good default is /etc/kubernetes (e.g. /etc/kubernetes/manifests) but this is likely something that users will want to configure. We should also allow both json and yml config. We might want to just include this as a subobject of componetconfig.KubeletConfiguration https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/componentconfig/types.go#L79
I believe the reason @mwielgus doesn't chose /etc/kubernetes/blah... because one request from @erictune is making this not kubernetes specific one.
Yes, I don't want put CM into the default kubernetes-related config.

Seems like this goes into /etc/cadvisor?
